title: Elementary reading and writing educational software evaluation competency enhancement course

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary Reading-Writing Instruction Theories and Software Application Experience
context.additional_context: Blended learning environment performing real-time interactive software evaluation practices on an online platform

learning_goals: Learners develop the ability to evaluate the appropriateness of elementary reading/writing software interfaces based on three criteria: intuitiveness, accessibility, and visual effectiveness.
Learners present five or more standards for determining the academic accuracy and grade-level suitability of educational content within software.
Learners apply a four-tier evaluation framework (none-basic-intermediate-advanced) to classify feedback systems (automated scoring, error analysis, etc.) in educational software.
Learners write comparative evaluation reports analyzing discrepancies between manufacturer claims and actual software functionality.

resources: Five types of educational software samples

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
